revised_title: The Medical Case of Astronomer Royal James Bradley
tldr: The article discusses the medical case of the late Rev. James Bradley, Astronomer Royal, who suffered from an uncommon illness involving inflammation and suppression of urine. The post-mortem examination revealed inflamed abdominal contents, enlarged and indurated prostate gland, and soft kidneys containing matter. The suppression of urine was likely due to the swelling and induration of the prostate gland, which closed the neck of the bladder, necessitating the use of a catheter.
